briefTitle: Phase III Study of Vinflunine Plus Methotrexate Versus Methotrexate Alone in Patients With Head and Neck Cancer
conditions: Recurrent or Metastatic Head and Neck Carcinoma

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Histologically or cytologically confirmed recurrent and/or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma
* Documented progressive disease after chemotherapy for locoregionally advanced or recurrent/metastatic SCCHN which included a platinum derivative
* Measurable or non measurable disease
* adequate haematological, hepatic and renal functions
* WHO performance status \< 1

Exclusion Criteria:

* Nasopharyngeal carcinoma
* History of brain or leptomeningeal involvement
* Albumin level \< 35 g/L
* Patients with weight loss â‰¥ 5% within the last 3 months
* Grade \> 2 peripheral neuropathy at study entry
* "Third space" fluids (pleural effusion, ascites, massive edema)
* Prior treatment with vinca-alkaloids and methotrexate

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival in the ITT Population (Months)
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization to the date of death or last follow-up. The survival duration of patients still alive, was censored at the date of last contact or last follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression Free Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Time measured from the date of randomisation until date of progression or death from any cause (whichever came first)

outcomeMeasures.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The objective response is defined as the best response designation recorded across all time points from the date of randomisation until disease progression.

outcomeMeasures.title: Disease Control Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of best overall responses CR, PR and SD in the analysed population

outcomeMeasures.title: Duration of Response
outcomeMeasures.description: Duration of objective response will be measured for responders (CR+PR) from the time for CR or PR until the 1st date of documentation of recurrent or progressive disease or the date of death any cause.
